intro: Egenolfia crenata, commonly known as the broadleaf sedge, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the wetlands and marshy areas of North America. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and grass-like plants. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves that are typically arranged in three rows, characteristic of many sedges. Egenolfia crenata thrives in moist to wet soils and is often found in swampy environments. It plays an important role in wetland ecosystems by stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
